author: costin
msg: Same thing as in jk - threads and request processors are registered in
JMX  (if coyote itself is registered and it registers the protocol adapter )

author: remm
msg: - It doesn't seem useful to do a recycle on init. Rather, initialize the fields needed.

author: costin
msg: Store a "control" object, for guard-based access control

author: costin
msg: When the coyote handler is registered ( by the Connector or other method ),
JkMain will register all handlers as mbeans.
If the coyote handler is not registered - nothing happens.

author: costin
msg: Let the handlers know their names.
A handler is a notification listener - right now the method is not
implemented, but will eventually call ( or replace ) invoke.
